title: BI Analyst (m/f/d) - Berlin, hybrid or 100% remote
jobdesc: YOUR ROLE AT ZOLARYou continuously improve a companywide reporting structure that fosters data driven decision makingYou help all departments within Operations to not only understand and accept data but embrace itYou engage with internal stakeholders to understand their business needs and find data-driven solutionsYou aggregate, analyze, and visualize Data to advice the Leads in Operations with actionable insightsYou have an affinity for presenting information in an articulate manner to various stakeholdersYou want to work on new concepts and create tools to improve the handling of our projectsYOUR QUALIFICATIONSYou have, at least, 3 years' experience in jobs working with complex data sets and conducting analyses to support important decisions in the companyYou have a bachelor's degree in a data driven study program such as statistics, engineering, computer science, or related disciplineYou have strong analytical skills and can structure your data in a way to be easily digestible by your peersYou have worked with Tableau (or similar data visualization tools) for creating analyses and reportsYou do not have any problem taking on new challenges in the daily work of your department and translate them into data-based solutionsYou like working in a team and actively support your colleaguesYou like taking on responsibility and have very good project management skillsYou are fluent in EnglishWhat zolar offers you100% remote working possible (within Germany) // Stay flexibleWhether you want to save yourself the commute to work or want to see your colleagues in person – you are free to choose how many days you work remotely or in the office.Workation // Stay curiousAs a digital company, we believe you can do your work just as well from the beach house in Portugal or the winter cabin in Sweden. That's why you can work up to 4 weeks per quarter from anywhere within the EU.Mental & physical health // Stay healthyYour mental and physical health is close to our hearts. In addition to a mental health program in cooperation with Mindsurance, you can expect a discounted M membership in Urban Sports Club.Company pension plan // Live well tomorrowA world worth living in is a matter close to our hearts, which is why we offer our employees support in their private retirement planning with the help of sustainable providers and an employer contribution of 20%.Benefitsy // You have the choiceYou get a monthly voucher budget of 50 € in the Benefitsy portal at your free disposal (e.g. Spotify, REWE, Sixt, IKEA and many more)Dog policy // Bring your own dogA variety of four-legged feel-good managers provide natural entertainment in the office and enjoy the attention of their two-legged colleagues.Buddy programme & (team) events // Involved instead of just employedGet off to a great start – with a buddy by your side and regular team- & company events.Tomorrow Bank // Sustainable BankingThanks to our cooperation with Tomorrow Bank, you receive the Change-model free of charge for 6 months and also support climate protection in banking. Instead of investing in coal power or weapons, Tomorrow invests the money into the future.Remote work equipment // Ready for workWe want you to be able to work as well at home as you can in the office, so we provide you with a one-off budget to purchase a desk, chair or other things you might need for your remote work.Clean energy for everyone.Out of love for our planet, we want to create a liveable future for all people with clean energy. Our mission is to put a solar system onto every roof in the world. We enable homeowners to produce their own green electricity and at the same time actively contribute to climate protection.Let's help shape the energy transition together - become part of our team!Our valuesClimate activists- We actively work on climate protection. As a team. Every day.Growth Mindset- We years for growth.Strong together- Together we are working towards the same goal. Differences make us stronger.Information matters- We respect each other in discussion. The strongest argument wins.New paths- By offering a digital solution to climate protection, we are part of the renewable energy revolution.Now more than ever- Instead of giving up, we go the extra mile.At zolar, we strive to provide a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for every person who works here or with us, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, size, socio-economic status, origin, age, culture, faith or religion (or lack thereof).

title: Big Data Analyst
jobdesc: Berlin, Berlin, GermanyYOUR FUTURE, ON DEMANDThe ideal blend of stability and flexibility. A genuinely human employer that cares for people and the planet. True autonomy to shape what comes next, for us and you. This is the perfect platform to take your career where you want.Back in 2005, we pioneered Europe’s first TV streaming service. Today, we’re the world’s first certified climate neutral TV streaming provider. 3 million users across three countries. Over 230 colleagues of 47 nationalities. We’re the grown-up start-up, helping to shape a better future since day one. That hasn’t changed, even if the world has. We’re friendly, international, inclusive – and our people say we’re reliable and transparent, too. It’s why they trust us and believe in what we do.THE ROLEData is a core advantage of OTT/Unicast TV over traditional broadcast. As platform operator we know exactly what content our users watch, how popular a show is and how many seconds of each and every ad campaign is viewed. With roughly 3 million active users every month the data we collect from them allows for efficient and precise business processes and data based decision making.We want to build day to day business decisions more on hard facts and less on gut feeling. Therefore we are searching for a passionate Big Data Analyst (f/m/x) to join our motivated and growing data team. You will be shaping the big data architecture in this company and building data components that change the way data is leveraged in this company!DATA AND ANALYTICS TEAMWe are a diverse set of people ranging from data engineers to data and product analysts and machine learning scientists. We love bringing more value out of our data for the organisation and truly drive data based decision making in all divisions. We are a bit nerdy and understand the heart of our business operations and our stakeholders to do our job well.Zattoo operates in both the DtC and B2B space and combined with a TV streaming product, it is a dream company for a data professional to get maximum value out of data and learn new things everyday! We are building a scalable architecture with the newest tools, technologies and methodologies to leverage our big data (we process 6TB daily!)WHAT YOU’LL DOIdentify and improve KPIs that are most relevant for driving product and business decisions and understand what affects end-users in our applicationsDesign dashboards that are tuned for decision making and insightsStrong communication and presentation skills with stakeholders ranging from business and product teams, our customers to engineersConduct data literacy sessions for stakeholders and our customersSpread the knowledge of data visualization and tools in the company to get other teams to be more self serviceOwn and Improve our data models and documentationCollaborate closely with our data engineers and engineering teams to ensure data quality and consistencyWHAT YOU’LL BRINGMaster’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or Statistics4+ years experience as a data analyst in a digital or tech company, analyzing large amounts of dataExperience working with general data visualization tools and product analytics tools (we use Indicative and Tableau)Ability to ‘connect the dots’ from a wide range of data from streaming quality data to NPS to user navigation and watch history to drive insightsGood understanding of statistics and the ability to translate results of analyses into insightsStrong SQL skills. Python skills are a plusKnowledge of tools like airflow and dbt are a plusStrong communication and collaboration skills with data stakeholders and Data EngineersWHY JOIN US?At Zattoo, you’re always on firm ground with real freedom to explore. You’ll have the support and opportunity you need to go far, while you’re helping us create a sustainable and entertainment-filled future for all.WHAT WE OFFER YOUReward: strong market competitive salaryRecharge: 30 days vacation plus public holidaysRegulate: trust based flexible working hours and the option for remote working 8 weeks per yearPlus:We’resharing:Free access to the best streaming experience on the marketWe're developing:Your own development budget, German classes and Zattoo all-company hack daysWe’re inclusive: ‘Zattooies’ are a fun, engaged, and diverse team made up of 47 nationalitiesWe’re healthy:Health checks, team sports, organic fruit, vegan options and more!We’re responsible:We are carbon neutral, an active employee Green team, discounted BVG tickets and free bike rentalsWe’re sociable:A calendar of events with fireside chats, lunches, in-house bar, BBQ’s, monthly socials, summer party and an annual off-site eventZattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. We are an equal opportunities employer, join us and help build a diverse team dedicated to the future of TV.You can learn more about us at: https://zattoo.com

title: (Junior) Data Engineer (m/w/d)
jobdesc: Berufseinsteigerdeutschlandweit / Homeoffice / Hybrid WorkingDie nachhaltige Veränderung von Unternehmen ist unsere Kernkompetenz. Als Umsetzungsboutique entwickeln wir nicht nur zukunftsfähige Konzepte, sondern packen gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden tatkräftig an, um diese in die Realität zu bringen. Voraussetzung für all das ist eine solide Datenbasis, um die richtigen datenbasierten Entscheidungen zu treffen.Zur Komplettierung unserer Teams suchen wir Dich als (Junior) Data Engineer (m/w/d).Eine herausfordernde und spannende Aufgabe…Oftmals fehlt unseren Kunden die notwendige Transparenz, um die richtigen, datenbasierten Entscheidungen zu treffen und das operative Geschäft zielführend zu steuern. Und das liegt keineswegs am Datenmangel. Denn Daten gibt es in Hülle und Fülle, nur liegen diese nicht strukturiert und dokumentiert an einem Ort vor. Millionen von (Kassen-)Transaktionsdaten bleiben so beispielsweise oft ungenutzt - und damit auch die dahinterliegenden Umsatzpotenziale.Als (Junior) Data Engineer (m/w/d) ist es Deine Aufgabe, diese zentrale Datenbasis herzustellen. Dazu bindest Du strukturierte und unstrukturierte Daten aus verschiedenen Kundenquellen in interne Analyseumgebungen ein und führst Plausibilitätschecks durch. Darauf basierend stellst Du standardisierte Auswertungen und Apps zur Verfügung und arbeitest eng im Team mit unseren Data Analysts.…für Menschen mit Datenfokus...Um dieser spannenden Aufgabe gerecht zu werden, solltest Du ein Studium (Master oder Bachelor) mit entsprechendem Schwerpunkt abgeschlossen haben und über fundiertes Wissen in Datenmodellierung und Data Management verfügen. Du solltest geübt im Umgang mit ERP-Systemen als Datenquelle und Datenbank-Technologie sein. Sehr gute Kenntnisse und Projekterfahrung in mindestens einem Datenbank-Managementsystem (z. B. SQL-Server, MySQL, Oracle, Db2, Data Warehouse Automation) sowie im Aufbau von Datenanalyse-Tools (z. B. Qlik) setzen wir voraus. Ein grundlegendes Verständnis für betriebswirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge ist ebenfalls notwendig.…in einem modernen Arbeitsumfeld.Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie.Bei nexpert gestaltest Du Deine Arbeitsumgebung selbst. Erzielst Du im Homeoffice die besseren Ergebnisse? Oder brauchst Du Dein Team live um Dich und willst den Arbeitsalltag unserer Kunden hautnah miterleben? Bei uns ist beides möglich - auch eine gesunde Mischung.Freiräume.Wir sind überzeugt, dass Vielfalt und Flexibilität die besten Erfolge zu Tage bringen. Mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und Office-Optionen, einem Sportangebot sowie der Möglichkeit zu Auszeiten und Workations schaffen wir Freiräume, um durchzuatmen, Inspiration zu tanken und Privat- und Berufsleben miteinander zu vereinbaren.Herzlich Willkommen.Von der ersten Sekunde an bist Du ein wertgeschätzter Teil des nexpert-Teams. Wir begleiten Dich mit strukturierten Onboarding-Maßnahmen während der gesamten Orientierungsphase. Damit Du Deinen Werkzeugkoffer schnell füllst und gut gewappnet für Deinen Einsatz bei Kunden bist.Persönliche Weiterentwicklung.Wir legen Wert auf Deine individuelle Entwicklung – sowohl fachlich als auch persönlich. Deine eigenen Vorstellungen reflektieren wir in strukturierten Entwicklungsgesprächen. Systematische und regelmäßige Feedback-Gespräche geben Orientierung bei der Erreichung von gemeinsam definierten Zielen. Zusätzlich unterstützen wir Dich durch regelmäßige Trainings, Workshops und Weiterbildungen.Vielfältige Zukunftsperspektiven.Wir bieten einen klaren Karrierepfad entlang unseres nScores, der trotzdem ausreichend Platz für Deine individuellen Ziele lässt. Durch die schnelle Übernahme von Verantwortung und tiefe Einblicke in unterschiedliche Branchen wächst Du schnell über Dich hinaus.Möglichkeit zur Mitgestaltung.Unsere Unternehmenskultur basiert auf dem Grundsatz, dass Jede und Jeder Ideen einbringen kann und soll. Hierzu folgen wir intern den Ansätzen der Soziokratie – damit nexpert ein lebendiges Unternehmen bleibt.Du fühlst Dich angesprochen und hast Lust auf diese Herausforderung?Wir freuen uns über Deine Online-Bewerbung.AnsprechpartnerLysann SchitzHuman ResourcesT: +49 (0)40-21 98 59 50nexpert AGCaffamacherreihe 820355 Hamburg

title: Praktikant Data Scientist / Data Analyst (m/w/d)
jobdesc: What's Next? Join ZF!ZF ist ein weltweit agierender Technologiekonzern, der Systeme für Pkw, Nutzfahrzeuge und Industrietechnik liefert und damit die Mobilität der nächsten Generation ermöglicht.In den vier Technologiefeldern Vehicle Motion Control, Integrated Safety, Automated Driving und Electric Mobility bietet ZF umfassende Produkt- und Softwarelösungen für etablierte Fahrzeughersteller und neu entstehende Transport- und Mobilitätsdienstleister. ZF elektrifiziert ein breites Spektrum an Fahrzeugtypen. Mit seinen Produkten trägt das Unternehmen dazu bei, Emissionen zu reduzieren, das Klima zu schützen und die sichere Mobilität zu verbessern.Praktikant Data Scientist / Data Analyst (m/w/d)Land/Region: DEStandort: Hannover, NI, DE, 30453Req ID 51530 Hannover, DeutschlandWir verstärken unser Team im Bereich Data Science / Data Analytics an unserem Standort in Hannover für ein Praktikum zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt.Ihre Aufgaben als Praktikant im Bereich Data Science / Data Analytics (m/w/d):Datenverarbeitung und Datenanalyse in PythonEntwicklung von Signalverarbeitungsalgorithmen im Zeit- sowie Frequenzbereich, insbesondere mit Fast Fourier Transform, Power Spectral Density, Continuous/Discrete Wavelet TransformationDefinition von Kriterien und Unterscheidungsmerkmalen sowie Evaluierung und Bewertung in der DatenanalyseModellierung und Klassifikation der SignaleDokumentation, Präsentation und Diskussion der Ergebnisse mit ExpertenIhr Profil als Praktikant im Bereich Data Science / Data Analytics (m/w/d):Sie studieren (Master) Elektrotechnik, Informatik, Mechatronik oder einen verwandten StudiengangStudienschwerpunkt und besonderes Interesse in Data Science, Data Analytics, Signal Processing sowie deren technischen AnwendungenGute Kenntnisse in Signaldatenmodellierung und -verarbeitungsmethoden und gute Kenntnisse in PythonTeamfähigkeit sowie selbständige, sorgfältige und zielorientierte ArbeitsweiseGute Englischkenntnisse (in Wort und Schrift)Werden Sie Teil unseres ZF-Teams als Praktikant Data Scientist / Data Analyst (m/w/d) und bewerben Sie sich jetzt!KontaktMichal VelkoborskýSo arbeiten wir bei ZF.Stellensegment:Research Scientist, Scientific, Database, R&D, Scientist, Science, Technology, Engineering, Research

title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
jobdesc: HamburgHomeofficeBerufserfahrungBerufserfahrung (Senior Level)Die HFG Gruppe ist der Spezialist für Langzeitinkasso in Deutschland. Seit über 30 Jahren widmet sich HFG der Beitreibung und dem Ankauf titulierter Forderungen im Mengengeschäft. Der Einzug von Fallmengen jeder Größenordnung steht bei den Tochtergesellschaften HFG Inkasso GmbH und der LZI Langzeitinkasso GmbH im Fokus. Innerhalb dieser Unternehmensgruppe arbeiten wir beständig an neuen Modellen und Methoden, um den Unternehmenserfolg kontinuierlich voranzutreiben.Deine Aufgaben:Hast Du Dich auch gerade gefragt, was ein Data Analyst w/m/d in einem Inkasso-Unternehmen machen könnte? Wir haben Boris (Deiner potenziellen Führungskraft) dieselbe Frage gestellt und das ist seine Antwort:Es ist unglaublich spannend die komplexen Daten bei HFG zu analysieren. Was meine ich damit? Wir haben zum einen eine ungewöhnlich lange Kundenbeziehung, da wir 30 Jahre Zeit haben, um eine Forderung geltend zu machen. Das bedeutet wir greifen über 30 Jahre lang auf die Datensätze zu, weshalb uns Datenqualität und Datenstruktur besonders wichtig sind. Wir finden für HFG mithilfe unserer zielgerichteten, analytisch gesteuerten Arbeitsweise heraus, wann es sich lohnt in genau die richtigen Forderungen zum richtigen Zeitpunkt zu investieren und geben entsprechende Handlungsempfehlungen. Wir erstellen weiterhin Dashboards und Reports für die Überwachung der Unternehmensprozesse. Zu unseren Tätigkeiten gehört außerdem die Datenmodellierung in unserem Data Warehouse.Wenn Du mehr über Boris und HFG erfahren möchtest, haben wir unten ein Youtube-Video verlinkt.Das bringst Du mit:Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt, z.B. Mathematik, Physik, (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Statistik oder eine vergleichbare QualifikationDu hast bereits Erfahrung mit der Analyse großer Datenmengen sowie in der Arbeit mit gängigen Data-Mining- und Statistik-ToolsZudem hast Du umfassende Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrungen im Umgang mit SQL-DatenbankenDu hast das Talent, mit unterschiedlichen Gesprächspartnern adressatengerecht zu kommunizieren und diese für Deine Themen zu gewinnenDu bringst gute Kenntnisse in der Anwendung einer höheren Programmiersprache (z.B. Java, Python, R etc.) mit und hast Lust, Dich hier weiterzuentwickelnTeamfähigkeit, eine hohe Auffassungsgabe und Deine Leidenschaft für das, was Du tust, runden Dein Profil abDarum arbeiten Deine Kolleg*innen bei HFG:"Ich kann meine Interessen in meinem Fachgebiet einbringen und gestalte die Lösungen mit. Meine Meinung zählt und wird eingeholt.""Mir gefällt die Mischung aus dem Home-Office und Vor-Ort-Arbeit, die mir eine flexible Gestaltung meines Arbeitstages erlaubt.""Ich freue mich jedes Mal, wenn ich mit KollegInnen den nächsten Spiele-Abend planen kann. Und damit meine ich spannende Coop-Spiele wie Left 4 Dead oder Overcooked."Hier findest Du weitere Benefits:Hohe Flexibilität bei der ArbeitszeitgestaltungHybrides Arbeiten: Home-Office-Lösungen und mobiles Arbeiten, aber auch ein wunderschönes Büro mit sehr guter Lage in der Hamburger Innenstadt, ProfiTicket und gute VerkehrsanbindungGute Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und FamilieIntensive Einarbeitung, Weiterbildungsangebote, Coaching und StudienförderungEin ausgeprägtes Gesundheitsmanagement, um Dich fit zu haltenIndividuelle Benefits, die auf Dich abgestimmt sind (z.B. mehr Urlaubstage, JobRad, Erholungsbeihilfe, Übernahme Kinderbetreuungskosten, Internetzuschuss, uvm.)Firmen- und MitarbeitereventsBetriebliche AltersvorsorgeWir feiern gemeinsam Deine Jubiläen bei unsWenn Du allgemeine Fragen hast, sind wir als Ansprechpartner für Dich da:Bettina JanertLeitung PersonalT +49 (0) 40 - 41 30 91 75Lisa DüringHR ManagerT +49 (0) 40 - 41 30 91 78Hauptansprechpartner zu dieser Stellenanzeige ist:Lisa DüringHR Manager040 41309 - 178Youtube-Inhalte aktivierenJa, ich möchte Inhalte von Youtube angezeigt bekommen. Ich bin einverstanden, dass dadurch meine personenbezogenen Daten an den Betreiber des Portals, von dem der Inhalt stammt, weitergegeben werden, so dass dieser mein Verhalten analysieren kann. Weitere Informationen finden Sie in unserer Datenschutzerklärung.INHALTE AKTIVIEREN

title: Operations Performance Analyst / Manager (m/f/d)
jobdesc: Company DescriptionWe are Flink - your online supermarket revolutionizing the way you do your grocery shopping. With a wide selection of over 2,400 high-quality products, we aim to deliver to your door in minutes. We put our customers first and ensure all products delivered are fresh and nutritious. Additionally, we can customize our national assortment to be able to offer you unique local products in every city. Our delivery hubs are located in densely populated inner-city locations and we strive to be sustainable by delivering on electric bikes and using packaging that can be recycled.If you want to be part of this exciting journey… read on!In your role asPerformance Analyst / Manageryou will own and track multiple operational and financial KPIs. You will make sense of our data and support country operations with valuable analyses to improve our performance. You will also need to keep an eye on the big picture as you work on cross-functional topics.Job DescriptionDevelop, maintain and improve KPI reports and dashboards that provide insights on operational and financial performanceDrive implementation of new KPIs and improve existing KPIsProvide quantitative and qualitative performance analyses and recommendations for performance improvementsFunction as point of contact for internal Stakeholders (e.g. Retail, Supply Chain, Marketing)QualificationsUniversity degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics or comparableStrong analytical and problem solving skills, paired with a data driven mindsetPrior experience in a related field (can also be through internships)Proficiency in MS Office / G-Suite (particularly Excel / Sheets), ideally complemented by database and statistical software knowledgeAdditional InformationA €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 daysA mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with RYDES, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providersA cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membershipAttractive company pension optionsUnlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German coursesOnline discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future BensA cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distanceWe pride ourselves in being an inclusive and equal opportunities employer with a diverse and multicultural team.It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
jobdesc: As a Data Analyst (m/f/d), you support the management of business processes. You combine data sources, create data products and reports and derive data-based recommendations for action.Places of work: Stuttgart / Karlsruhe / remote workYour tasks:As a Data Analyst (m/f/d) you are responsible for the development, operation and optimisation of qualitative and quantitative control instruments.In doing so, you support the business processes and derive data-supported recommendations for action for the business departments and the management.As interface between the specialist departments and IT, you coordinate data flows, collate data and present it visibly in the form of reports.With foresight, you further develop the analysis methods and data sources used with the aim of recognizing new correlations that are relevant to the success of the business.You accompany the operational implementation of data products, e.g. intelligent algorithms to support decision-making processes.This is what you should bring with you:You have a degree in mathematics, (business) computer science, statistics or a comparable field.You have already gained experience in the analysis of large amounts of data and the implementation of analytical models.You have strong analytical and conceptual skills to identify and process relevant correlations, even from large amounts of data.You have very good programming skills in e.g. R or Python.You have very good knowledge of SQL, relational databases and various RDBMS.Ideally, you have already gained initial experience with cloud platforms such as Azure and relevant services (Data Factory, Batch Services).You can work independently and on your own responsibility.You communicate confidently and fluently in German and English.What do we offer?We offer a full-time permanent position. title: Data Analyst (w/m/d) Marketing
jobdesc: SGP ist eine bundesweit agierende Wirtschaftskanzlei, die für kleine und mittelständische Unternehmen sowie Konzerne aus unterschiedlichen Branchen Lösungen entwickelt. Wir arbeiten zusammen in interdisziplinären Teams und einem Netzwerk aus Fachkräften. Wir blicken über den Tellerrand, streben nach Ergebnissen, die Bestand haben und wir haben eine Mission: Unternehmen besser machen. Das schaffen wir, indem wir in einer Atmosphäre es Miteinanders und gegenseitigen Respekts gemeinsam wachsen.Ihre AufgabenDatenanalyse– Sie erarbeiten Konzepte für die Analyse von Daten und setzen diese im Rahmen der Mandantenstrategie mit Fokus auf Marketing Automation und Personalisierung um.Teamarbeit– Sie realisieren ganzheitliche Data Analytics-Use Cases und Dashboards zur Unterstützung der Marketingaktivitäten: Von der Vernetzung, Modellierung und Aufbereitung der Daten bis hin zur zielgerichteten Datenanalyse und Visualisierung.Lösungsorientierung– Sie interpretieren Analyseergebnissen und unterstützen durch Handlungsempfehlungen.Evolution– Sie arbeiten mit bei der (Weiter-)entwicklung unserer Daten- und Analytics-Infrastruktur, der Data Governance sowie dem Einsatz von ML.Ihre FähigkeitenQualifikation– Sie haben ein abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik mit Data Analytics-Schwerpunkt bzw. einer vergleichbaren Vertiefung.Erfahrung– Sie kennen sich im Bereich anspruchsvoller Datenanalysen, Business Intelligence und/oder Data Science, vorzugsweise im Marketingumfeld gut aus und haben in diesem Bereich bereits gearbeitet.Praxis– Sie besitzen Kenntnisse über die Best Practices in Data Mining CRISP-DM oder ASUM-DM sowie eine der führenden Data Analytics Plattformen, z. B. Tableau, und haben diese bereits angewendet.Daten-Affinität– Ihnen sind die gängigen Tools zur Datenanalyse und -visualisierung, idealerweise mit Microsoft Power BI, Google Analytics, Matlab, Programmiersprachen Python und oder R inkl. RStudio bekannt.Leidenschaft– Praktische Erfahrungen im Marketing Automation-Umfeld / Data-Driven Marketing sind wünschenswert, erweitertes Vorwissen zum Zusammenspiel von CRM-Systemen, Customer Data Plattformen & Marketing Automation-Lösungen ist von Vorteil.Agilität– Sie setzen Ihre analytischen und kreativen Fähigkeiten mit einer guten Portion Hands-on-Mentalität ein.Teamplayer– Sie haben Freude an der interdisziplinären Zusammenarbeit.Ihre BenefitsWir sind 320 neugierige Menschen, die sich gern vernetzen, ihr Wissen teilen und mit ihren Aufgaben wachsen. Im Team können Sie sich den täglichen Herausforderungen stellen.Wir bieten Ihnen ein wertschätzendes Arbeitsumfeld mit spannenden Aufgaben, bei denen Sie über dich selbst hinauswachsen können. Wir begleiten Sie dabei. Außerdem bieten wir:Individuelle WeiterbildungsmöglichkeitenTeam-EventsRabatt-ProgrammeFlexible ArbeitszeitenDetails über die StelleTitel: Data Analyst (w/m/d) MarketingArt der Anstellung: VollzeitUnternehmen: SGP Schneider GeiwitzStandort: Neu-Ulm

title: Data Analyst Sales (m/w/d)
jobdesc: *Die Position hat den Dienstort Hannover, kann aber zu einem Anteil mobil ausgeführt werden.*Für dieTUI Deutschland GmbHsuchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine/nData Analyst Sales (m/w/d).Datenanalyse ist deine Stärke, du willst aber auch konkrete Ableitungen für’s Business treffen? Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsinformatik) und verfügst über relevante BerufserfahrungDu bringst exzellente Kenntnisse in Datenaufbereitung, -analyse, und -visualisierung mit (Excel, SQL, Tableau; eine Programmiersprache wie Python ist wünschenswert) sowie statistische Kenntnisse mitKenntnisse im Bereich Provisionsmanagement/Vertriebssteuerung sind wünschenswertDu besitzt ein ausgeprägtes Verständnis für ökonomische Zielsetzungen in UnternehmenDeine Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sind verhandlungssicherDu hast eine selbständige Arbeitsweise, ein hohes Maß an Flexibilität und ausgeprägte Kommunikationsstärke in Hinblick auf die Beratung von unterschiedlichen StakeholdernDu bist belastbar, behältst einen kühlen Kopf und den Überblick, auch wenn es mal stressig wirdUNSER ANGEBOTArbeiten im größten globalen Touristikkonzern: Wir stehen für interkulturelle Zusammenarbeit und bieten die Möglichkeit der Arbeit in internationalen Projekten und TeamsMobiles Arbeiten und flexible Arbeitszeiten: Wir glauben, dass Arbeit etwas ist, was man tut, und nicht wohin man geht. title: Data Analyst Process Mining - Financial Services Teilzeit/Vollzeit (w/m/d)
jobdesc: Deine AufgabenIT-Lösungen- Du entwickelst innovative Lösungen zur Analyse von großen Datenmengen.Optimiere Geschäftsprozesse- Mit interdisziplinären Teams arbeitest du an der Schnittstelle zwischen Prozessen und IT. Du begleitest führende Banken und Versicherungen von der datenbasierten Aufnahme ihrer Prozesse bis hin zur Prozessanalyse und Ableitung konkreter Optimierungs- und Automatisierungsmaßnahmen.Erlebe technische Vielfalt- Du setzt Kundenprojekte und Themen mit Hilfe unserer digitalen Lösungen und Datenmodelle um und visualisiert aussagekräftige Analysen in marktführenden Process Mining Tools.Datenqualitätsmanagement- Du erweiterst dein Wissen im Bereich Datenqualitätsmanagement und unterstützt so deine Projektteams und Kunden bei der Sicherstellung der Datenqualität in relevanten IT-Systemen und Datenbanken.Entwickle dich stetig weiter- Dich erwarten flache Hierarchien mit viel eigener Verantwortung. Zusammen mit deiner:m People Manager:in arbeitest du aktiv an deiner Karriereentwicklung. Dazu gehören u.a. ein attraktives Weiterbildungsangebot der PwC Academy sowie externe Schulungen und Zertifizierungen im Bereich Process Mining.Arbeite wie es zu deinem Leben passt: mit FlexWork. Keine fixen Home-Office-Tage, sondern deine Chance Arbeitszeit und -ort variabel zu gestalten.Dein ProfilDein Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, des (Wirtschafs-) Ingenieurwesens, der Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung hast du bereits abgeschlossen oder schließt dieses in Kürze ab.Du bringst Interesse an Process Mining, Data Mining und Datenanalyse-Technologien mit.Idealerweise verfügst du über Anwendungskenntnisse in einer der gängigen Sprachen, z.B. Python, PQL oder R. Außerdem kennst du dich mit gängigen Datenbanktechnologien wie bspw. SQL aus.Du interessierst dich für die Finanzbranche und möchtest deine Kenntnisse über die typischen Finanzprozesse (z.B. Kreditprozess oder Handel von Wertpapieren) erweitern.Kommunikationsstärke und Kenntnisse im Projektmanagement zählen ebenso wie sehr gute analytische Fähigkeiten und Teamfähigkeit zu deinen Stärken.Deine BenefitsÜberstundenausgleich: Bei PwC werden alle Überstunden ausgeglichen – entweder als Freizeitausgleich oder als zusätzliche Vergütung. Du hast die Wahl!Standortbezogene Extras: Bei PwC profitierst du von einer ganzen Reihe an Vorteilen - angefangen bei gesunden Mahlzeiten in den Casinos vor Ort, Vergünstigungen in Restaurants und im Einzelhandel über Jobtickets bis hin zu kostenlosen Betriebssportangeboten wie Yoga oder HIIT Workouts.Die abgebildeten Leistungen können je nach Position, Geschäftsbereich und Standort leicht variieren.A-103995Lara Georgy,Tel.: +49 211 9811417Gerne kannst du dich bei uns in Deutsch oder Englisch bewerben. Wenn du Schwierigkeiten mit deiner Bewerbung hast, stehen wir dir unter Tel. 069 9585 6800 jederzeit zur Verfügung.Allgemeine Fragen zu PwC und den Einstiegsmöglichkeiten beantworten wir dir gerne unter Tel. 069 9585 5226.

title: Venture Capital Visiting Analyst (Internship)
jobdesc: About us:SquareOne is a venture capital firm that’s backing exceptional European founders who leverage technology to solve complex B2B problems in large markets. Founded in 2010, the Berlin-based investor is one of Europe’s leading early stage venture firms investing in B2B SaaS, Enterprise Software and Deep Tech Startups out of its €100m fund. Numerous SME & blue chip executives as well as leading tech entrepreneurs are active members of the SquareOne community & investor base. Leveraging this network enables SquareOne to offer a “first-customer(s) guarantee” to all its early stage portfolio companies. Beyond its network, SquareOne acts as an entrepreneurial sparring partner and hands-on supporter. Since its launch, SquareOne has invested in more than 40 start-ups and counts companies like Stripe, Pipedrive, Wandelbots or Detectify as part of its portfolio.We are a small and ambitious team, that values a great working culture and whose daily work is characterized by flat hierarchies and open communication. Working alongside our Partners, you will get to know the exciting and highly challenging work of a Venture Capital in Berlin and be in charge of your own projects & deals from start to finish.What awaits youYou will be assisting the partners and investment-team in the deal-flow processes up to the negotiations with potential portfolio companiesYou will take care of the valuation and analysis of potential investment cases as well as related market-, industry- and technology deep-divesYou will proactively research and analyse market and industry trends to identify the best early stage companies and founding teamsYou will give operative support to portfolio companies in online marketing, company building, business development and salesYou will create investment proposals and presentations for internal and external useEnrollment in a top-tier university program related to finance, business or engineeringDeep understanding of digital business-models combined with the analytical skill-set for data-based evaluationFirst experiences in high-growth startups, venture capital and private-equity or in other fast-paced environments within investment banking, strategy-consulting or later stage techHumble team players onlyExcellent command of German (C1) and English and strong interpersonal and digital communication skillsIdeally, you are available for a time period of 4+ months.If you would like to have some insights on what an intern can expect at SquareOne, feel free to click and read :)JakobAllisonStephanMaxNiklasEsther

title: Data Analyst (gn)
jobdesc: LichtBlick sucht dich! Ab sofort unbefristet in Voll- und Teilzeit. Für grüne Energie im Bereich Data.Dein Job:Du ermöglichst Lichtblick die datengetriebene Entscheidungsfindung, indem du Probleme verstehst, passende Daten findest und Handlungsempfehlungen und Interpretationen abgibstDu arbeitest in einem interdisziplinären Team mit Data Engineers, Data Scientists und Business Ownern und bildest die Schnittstelle zwischen Tech und BusinessDu nutzt interaktive Reporting-Tools, analysierst Vertriebskanäle und weitere Prozesse und deckst Potenziale zur Effizienzsteigerung aufDu sorgst mit dem Aufbau einer einheitlichen Dashboardlandschaft und Berichtsinfrastruktur für eine hohe Transparenz im Unternehmen und eine grüne Zukunft für alleDeine Skills:Du hast dein mathematisches oder naturwissenschaftliches Studium oder einen vergleichbaren Studiengang erfolgreich abgeschlossenDu hast ein Herz für Zahlen – und für grüne ThemenDu konntest deine Expertise bereits erfolgreich in der Praxis anwenden, erweitern und ausbauenDaten sind für dich keine nichtssagenden Zahlenkolonnen, sondern die wichtigste Grundlage für alle BusinessentscheidungenDu scheust dich nicht, in die Tiefen der LichtBlick Datenlandschaft einzutauchen und auch mal unbequeme Wahrheiten zutage zu bringen und anzusprechenDu beherrschst Excel und hast erste Erfahrung mit Python oder R (SQL/Power-BI-Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil)Du hast Lust, mit agilen Methoden zu arbeiten und in deinen Arbeitsalltag zu integrierenDu bist gern Teil von etwas Großem und teilst dein Wissen und deine Erkenntnisse im Team sowie mit anderen AbteilungenTop-Englisch in Wort und Schrift? Yes, please!Das Angebot:Dich erwarten interessante, anspruchsvolle Aufgaben und vieles mehr. Zum Beispiel eine faire, transparente Gehalts- und Karriereentwicklung und vielfältige Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten in der LichtBlick Academy. Oder eine flexible Arbeitsgestaltung mit freier Zeiteinteilung, mobilem Arbeiten und Freizeitausgleich von Überstunden. Du kannst remote arbeiten oder in unserem modernen Loft-Büro. title: Data Analyst
jobdesc: Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As aPublic Benefit Corporation, you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.The RoleVeeva Link’s vision is to build connected data applications to improve research and patient outcomes. We are looking for an organized and experienced data analyst to join the Veeva Link product team.You will participate in the development and implementation of a data governance framework. Your primary responsibility will be establishing processes for continuously monitoring data quality and working with various teams to remediate identified gaps. You will ensure the overall quality of scientific leader profiles for our product.You will also be responsible for further developing and managing data policies, standards, and processes. The ideal candidate will have experience in quantitative data analysis and developing manuals, process outlines, or implementation procedures.What You’ll DoFurther develop and manage data policies, standards, and processesEnsure processes are in place to proactively detect, correct and prevent invalid data valuesEnsure high quality of key people profilesDevelop data quality metrics that identify gaps and ensure compliance with standards across the organizationWork with the operational and software development teams to remediate identified gaps using both manual and automated solutionsCreate weekly data quality reports and updatesRequirementsUniversity degree in medicine or life sciencesWorking experience in a data analytical roleProficient computer skills, Microsoft Office or Google SuiteExposure to SQL query writing and scripting (Python)Comfortable working with data and making data-driven decisionsGood interpersonal skills and communication with all levels within the organizationOrganized and able to manage multiple timelines, projects, and schedulesAble to analyze problems and strategize for better solutionsExperienced in developing manuals, process outlines, and implementation proceduresNice to HaveExperience with one or more Data Analysis tools, e.g., Knime, Tableau, etcComfortable working in an agile environmentExperienced with Atlassian JiraExperienced with healthcare/pharmaceutical dataPerks & BenefitsFitness reimbursementA significant contribution to the pension fundLife insurancePersonal development budget#RemoteGermanyVeeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

title: Data Analyst - Digital Marketing (all genders)
jobdesc: For 25 years, Native Instruments has been at the heart of musical innovation. We've created communities, pushed technological boundaries, and opened new creative horizons for amateurs and professionals alike. Guided by our mission to make music creation more inclusive and accessible, Native hardware, software, and digital services provide fully-integrated solutions for musicians, producers, and DJs of all genres and levels of experience.Native Instruments is part of Soundwide, whose mission is to make music and audio creation a more joyful and inspiring experience for creators everywhere by helping them to find, and stay in, their creative flow. Soundwide's collective vision is to inspire and empower creators to express themselves and reimagine the future of sound.OurCommercial Data Insightsteamdesigns, builds and maintains data models, reports and dashboards for stakeholders throughout our organization. We manage, evaluate and mine vast volumes of web, sales, customer and usage data for information and insights to enable data-informed business choices. Our data team collaborates with all level contributors in Marketing and Product Creation on stimulating projects, transforming Soundwide into an insights driven organization where analysis, data and reasoning are embedded in all decisions - large and small.What You'll DoEvaluate user experience, engagement and purchasing data across our digital touchpoints to provide insights and actionable advice for marketing purposes;Collaborating with our Digital Marketing Managers, you will develop insightful reports & dashboards to evaluate and optimize campaign performance;Turn business questions into clear analysis problems and search for answers by assessing historical information, collecting new data and conducting experiments;You will collaborate with data engineers, data scientists and digital marketing managers at different levels of seniority to implement a data strategy, expand our data-driven marketing campaigns and increase the data literacy throughout our organization;Build relationships and connect with a range of internal stakeholders to create and refine the tools and processes needed to support the commercial growth of our e-commerce business.What You'll NeedYou bring previous working experience in similar roles, having operated in more technical positions (i.e data engineer, web developer or BI developer) would be considered a plus for this role;A strong investigative mindset and your demonstrated ability to collaborate with stakeholders and translate requests into requirements;A profound knowledge of SQL is a must, any additional knowledge of Python or R is a plus;A solid understanding of descriptive statistics and exploratory data analysis;Experience with modern data analytics tools and platforms, especially the Google stack: Google Analytics / Tag Manager / Ads, BigQuery, Data Studio;Your demonstrated experience in leveraging analytics and systematic experimentation to improve e-commerce KPIs for customer acquisition and engagement;Hands-on experience in data-driven performance optimisation in one or more of these areas: email and digital ad campaigns, attribution modeling, conversion rate optimization;Your strong sense of ownership, and your ability to achieve high-quality results based on imperfect data;You are fluent in English with strong verbal and visual communication skills in order to present your findings to diverse audience groups.About UsNative Instruments is a Soundwide company; together we embrace diversity and a respect for all people.We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we believe the foundation of our dynamic and pioneering spirit starts with a fair and inclusive culture. At Soundwide we strive to embrace teamwork and passion, deliver inspiring experiences, continuously innovate and empower our communities, while also serving our planet.All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment at Native Instruments and we encourage everyone to apply – regardless of gender identity, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.Help us reach our goal in making the future of music diverse, inclusive and exciting! We encourage you to submit your application without the requirement for a photograph, identifying factors or personal status information.

title: Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d)

Dafür brauchen wir Menschen, die etwas bewegen wollen. Die nicht nur glänzen wollen, sondern im Team erfolgreich sind. Die Lust haben, den gesellschaftlichen Diskurs auf ein neues Level zu bringen. Karten für Heimspiele von Mainz 05, Kulturveranstaltungen und Leserreisen.Dein ArbeitsplatzWir möchten Dir das Arbeiten so angenehm wie möglich machen und bezuschussen daher Dein Mittagessen, bieten Zugang zu allen VRM-Produkten inklusive WLAN.Weitere VorteileUnterstützung bei der Pflege naher Angehöriger, Ferienspiele für Kinder von Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern, Bügelservice, Annahme privater Pakete.Sanja LabestinHR Business PartnerTel.:+49 (0)6131 484316E-Mail schreibenXINGHaben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?Dann bewirb Dich noch heute. title: Business Analyst Airline Operations (m/f/d)
jobdesc: The position is based in Hanover / Germany, but can also be managed remotely from another city in Germany or from one of our EU / UK locations.*Feel free to apply in English or German.*ABOUT THE JOBAs a Business Analyst, you are part of a cross-functional team that delivers software products and support from conception to operation.You will collaborate with architects, data analysts, digital analysts, product owners, software developers, technology leads and UX/UI designers to clearly define, document and communicate requirements that will enable implementation of new changes and enhancements to our digital platforms in an agile mannerYou’re responsible for evaluating solution options, consulting with stakeholders as needed to define and articulate business needs in a way that enables the design and delivery of technical solutions that add value across TUI global platforms and servicesYou use your deep understanding of TUI products and systems, business models, processes, data flows and their link to business capabilities to plan and deliver high quality business analysis that supports the ongoing delivery of growth and digital transformation across our key marketsWorking alongside a varied set of technology and business stakeholders, you define and document new business, user, and system requirements, considering impacts to upstream/ downstream servicesYou manage the requirement lifecycle from planning through to elicitation, testing, delivery, and business acceptanceYou can provide business analysis to multiple agile and waterfall delivery teams and work closely with the product owner/business lead/others to prioritise and manage complex backlogsYou distil the needs of business and using your strong collaboration skills you support your team to deliver the best solutions to our customers’ needsYou are commercially astute, focusing on solving business problems in the best wayABOUT YOUStrong analytical skills and commercial acumen. Adept at understanding complex problems and communicating findings to technical and non-technical stakeholdersCollaborative approach, able to balance the needs of multiple stakeholders and facilitate agreement across multiple markets in a global structureProficient at using requirements elicitation methods including business process modelling (BPM), UML, test/use cases and prototypingExperience creating, analysing and validating detailed functional specifications and elements of systems design; including data rules, business rules, wireframes or other detailed deliverables that articulate how a business need should be satisfiedGood track record of successfully using requirements elicitation and communication techniques including workshop facilitation, documentation analysis, interviewing and brainstormingExperience in the design of IT systems as well as in requirements management in the airline or tourism environmentWorking knowledge of databases and SQLGood knowledge of AWS or cloud desirable, but not essentialProfound mastery in communication skills to work with interdisciplinary teams. Ability to explain complex IT solutions to non-technical stakeholders and business partners and communicate requirements and specify these on a technical level to IT developers.Very good organisational and problem-solving abilityExperience in working in hybrid cloud environment (AWS knowledgeAnalytical thinker with the ability to work conceptuallyHigh-level social and teamwork skillsExperience of creating user stories, epics and acceptance criteria is agile environmentA good understanding of agile/lean software delivery methodology, tools and techniques and the software development lifecycle including knowledge of Scrum and KanbanCustomer centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and servicesABOUT OUR OFFERWorking in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.Mobile working and flexible working hours: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go. Our offer: newWork@TUI (hybrid working) & TUI Workwide (Working from abroad)Development and career opportunities: We promote the potential of our employees with a wide range of (digital) training opportunities and international career opportunities.Personal benefits: We offer attractive remuneration with holiday bonus, generous travel benefits, extensive health & wellbeing offers and much more.We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. title: Data Analyst / Data Product Owner (m/f/x)
jobdesc: Your role:You will play a crucial role in shaping the future of Data Analytics and actively contribute to the success of the digital transformation at ZEISS. In this challenging function, you will help our business units to identify and develop strategic data-driven use case opportunities. As a data analyst at Zeiss Digital Partners, you are part of our Data & Analytics team and work in a supportive, team-oriented environment that enables the co-design and development of customer-centric digital products. You will also become part of the vibrant Zeiss data analytics and machine learning community. Together with your colleagues, you deliver value-adding insights and create a comprehensive data-enabled experience and data driven business for ZEISS customers through ingenious data transformations and solid analyses combined with vivid data visualizations. You will help the stakeholders with technical questions as well as with the implementation of their requirements in concrete specifications for the data solutions taking consideration of the data quality.In this role you will:Perform in-depth data analysis in a variety of areas (e.g. production, supply chain management, intralogistics, customer 360°, web analytics, etc.)Support our business segments with specific evaluations as well as analyzing and preparing data, data sources and interfaces of different (structured and unstructured) formatsConnect data from different data sources (esp. ERP or CRM systems), define user-oriented measurement values (KPIs) and provide valuable insights through suitable visualizations and exploratory data analysisAssess technical feasibility - develop prototypes and sustainable solutions on your own by using advanced analytics, statistics and machine learning approachesIdentify potential solution scenarios, systems and data sources to support prototype and product realizationCreate and visualize reports and recommendations for decision makingYour profile:excellent university degree, preferably computer science, natural sciences, or engineering, paired with a passion for data and its visualizationat least 3+ years of professional experience in a Data Scientist, Data Visualization, Data Engineering or Data Analyst rolea deep understanding of extracting valuable information from data applying descriptive statistics, advanced analytics or machine learningexperience in agile software development using python, git and Azure DevOpsexpertise in data visualization tools like Microsoft Power BIexpertise in Cloud technologies like Microsoft Azure, spark-based data transformation (pySpark/ Databricks) and database systems (SQL and No-SQL)experience in stakeholder management in digital analytics projectscustomer-oriented, open-minded, and self-reliant way of working;fast, analytical, and proactive mindset with an eye for detailexcellent communication and presentation skills in English, German is a plusYour ZEISS Recruiting Team:Annett Burger, Markus Repp

jobdesc: Company DescriptionTeamViewer is a leading global technology company that provides a cutting-edge platform to remotely access, control and support devices of any kind. our analytics data.Maintain and improve data applications that help to optimize our TeamViewer productsCommunicate with stakeholders and users of our data products by understanding their problems and warehouse to work with large amounts of data of a product which has millions of users all over the worldQualificationsUniversity degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Information Systems or equivalent experience with a focus on data2+ years of relevant professional data experienceExcellent SQL skills are requiredProven experience in variety of projects in data handling & analysisGood knowledge in one or more of the following tools is required: Git, DBT or BigQueryHighly motivated to solve complex problems and being able to go out of the comfort zone in close collaboration with other team membersGoal-oriented and eager to make a real difference to the businessGreat communication skills which compliment your interactions with internal and external days of work outside your contracting countryWe celebratediversityas one of core values, join and drive one of the c-a-r-e initiatives together with us!TeamViewer is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to building an inclusive culture where everyone feels welcome and supported. As we continue to grow as a company, we also focus on enabling our employees to grow both personally and professionally. title: Intern Data Analyst - Finance (m/f/d)
jobdesc: AsIntern Data Analystyou will support directly our Finance Analytics & Systems (FA&S) team, developing dashboards and models which will help the team analyze and evaluate patterns across different processes and systems. This position is located in Munich and is limited to 6 months.WHAT YOU'LL DObe a key contributor to our Finance team focused on delivering a world-class e-commerce shopping experienceassist in the creation and development of state-of-the-art KPI dashboards and other reporting tools for our FP&A and Accounting teams, to easily track and identify trends in our most relevant processesconduct various data analyses and data modelling to generate invaluable insights for our team (based on needs and findings)provide invaluable insights to the leadership teamYOU COME WITHa Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or similarexcellent skills in Excel and Tableau (or any equivalent visualization software); additional programming skills (e.g. VBA, Python ) and SQL are a plusa passion for solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches and for translating your insights into data-driven and actionable recommendationsability to balance a fast-paced working environment with the need for precision.fluency in EnglishWHAT YOU CAN EXPECTworking in an international, diverse team of experts in a dynamic and fast-paced e-commerce environmentcountless opportunities to grow your career and shape your professional futurecentrally located and dog-friendly offices with free beverages, cafeteria with different lunch options, diverse sports and health offerings and regular team and afterwork eventsabove average salary and up to 40% employee discount, volunteering day off, company pension scheme, discounted mobility options (e.g. public transport, JobRad, SwapfietsWhat are you waiting for? Apply via our online form. We are looking forward to your application including your possible starting date. If you have any questions regarding the job, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team.Please note that we don’t accept Email-Applications!Diversity is deeply rooted in the Westwing culture. Our mission doesn’t stop to inspire only your design choices, it continues to embrace an inclusive lifestyle filled with respect to everyone’s uniqueness, cultural differences and equal opportunity.ABOUT WESTWINGBeing part ofWestwingmeans working in an inspiring and diverse environment that enables you to grow. title: Data Analyst SAP (m/w/d)
jobdesc: Job Profile SummaryStandort Bochum,befristet auf 12 MonateBei bp haben wir nur eins im Kopf: die Energie von morgen. Wir wollen Energie neu denken, damit wir bis spätestens 2050 klimaneutral sind. Und damit die Welt es auch werden kann. Dafür denken wir Energie neu und setzen dabei auf die Kompetenz und Leidenschaft unserer rund 70.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter weltweit, davon 4.600 in Deutschland. Sie sichern jeden Tag mit den Produkten und Dienstleistungen unserer Marken bp, Aral und Castrol die Energie und Mobilität für Millionen Menschen – heute und in Zukunft.Täglich werden bei 2.500 Tankstellen im deutschen Tankstellengeschäft Kraftstoff und Shopumsätze abgerechnet. Der Stelleninhaber unterstützt bei der Erhaltung der Stabilität der Prozesse im globalen SAP-SystemJob AdvertIhr Aufgabenbereich:Unterstützung bei der laufenden Überprüfung der SAP-Systeme und Sicherstellung der DatenintegritätErstellung von ReportsLieferung von entsprechenden KPIs zur Messung der Datenqualität und ProzesssicherheitUnterstützung bei der Einleitung entsprechender Korrekturen, automatisch über das System oder in Zusammenarbeit mit dem FachbereichDurchführen der User Acceptance TestsSchnittstelle zu den Anwendern und Service DeskErstellung von Tickets und Nachhalten in entsprechenden TrackernErkennung von technischen Problemen bei der Durchführung von Zahlläufen in SAPBearbeitung von Fehlerprotokollen aus SAP-Systemen zur Sicherstellung einer korrekten und rechtzeitigen Abrechnung der Tankstellen in DeutschlandUnterstützung bei Superuser-ForenVerantwortlicher Ansprechpartner bei Problemen im Tagesgeschäft mit SAP-Prozessen, Stammdatenpflege und allgemeinen Problemen mit der Bedienung der SAP-SystemeUnterstützung bei Training und Coaching neuer SAP EnduserAnsprechpartner für bestehende und neue SAP-Reportings zur Unterstützung des TagesgeschäftsDokumentation SAP-relevanter GeschäftsprozesseWissensträger zu allen SAP-Belegen, Rechenwegen, Abrechnungsmodalitäten und StammdatenschlüsselungenSupport bei der Entwicklung von Checklisten und Formularen zur Datenerfassung durch Data Admins für alle notwendigen Stammdaten in SAP bei Tankstellenneueröffnungen und -schließungen, Partnerwechseln und sonstigen Veränderungen im TagesgeschäftDas sollten Sie mitbringen:Sehr gute SAP-KenntnisseSehr gute Kenntnisse der MS-Office Produkte, insbesondere ExcelSehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und SchriftHohe Selbstmotivation, gepaart mit starker Performance-Orientierung und einer Leidenschaft für Process ExcellenceSehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit und sicheres Auftreten im Innen- und AußenverhältnisGute Belastbarkeit in Stresssituation, verbunden mit hoher Flexibilität sowie gutes ZeitmanagementOrganisationsgeschick gepaart mit einer selbstständigen ArbeitsweiseAusgeprägte Kundenorientierung (intern/extern) und ein freundliches AuftretenFähigkeit auch komplexe Sachverhalte über alle Niveaus zu vermittelnWir leben Chancengleichheit und legen Wert auf Vielfalt in unserem Unternehmen. Wir betonen ausdrücklich, dass bei uns alle Menschen - unabhängig von Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung - gleichermaßen willkommen sind.EntityCustomers & ProductsJob Family GroupRetail GroupRelocation availableNoTravel requiredNoTime TypeFull timeCountryGermanyAbout BPCUSTOMER AND PRODUCTSWe’re gearing up for the future. At bp our goal for C&P is to deliver the future of mobility, energy and services for our customers by innovating with new business models and service platforms.C&P will become a hub, housing our midstream, lubricants, aviation, sale of chemicals, mobility and ‎convenience, marketing and our next-generation businesses, making it a highly integrated and ‎interconnected organisation. And with safety being our core value, our commitment to safe and reliable operations will never change.Want to join the team? This means:being customer-centric, agile and responsive to changing customer needs and dynamic marketsfocusing on growth and development of customer offersoptimising the chemicals and fuels value chains to maximise integrated valuecontributing to the reduction of carbon intensity of the products we create, and sell, by 50% by 2050 or soonercreating strategic partnerships that drive long-term value for C&Pbeing digitally enabled and empowered by customer insights and data to deliver solutions.Experience LevelEntryLegal disclaimerWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, neurodiversity/neurocognitive functioning, veteran status or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodations.

title: (Senior) Continuous Improvement Data Analyst (B2B) (all genders)
jobdesc: THE ROLE & THE TEAMWe are an international team of three that supports the logistics network with analysis and data dashboards. We talk to our stakeholders in the logistics warehouses and provide KPIs to make them comparable in the network. This includes creating ad-hoc analysis or long-term ETLs and corresponding dashboards. Your tasks will depend on your capability and range from supporting projects from data perspective to leading your own projects and getting support from our colleagues. We are supporting each other, doing team reviews, and helping each team member get to the next level.INCLUSIVE BY DESIGNAt Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategyOur employee resource groups: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groupsWHAT WE'D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)You are working with data that you can actually visit on-site. You work independently on logistics data projects, and verify these with your stakeholders. You are helping to understand processes and their weak points to make us even better and solve something that matters.You are a contact person when it comes to data-related questions about system-supported Logistics processes and reports, align and specify requirements, and are able to answer questions from technical and non-technical point of view.You will be working with state-of-the-art tools, with a team open to new ways to work even more efficiently. With those tools, you will execute quantitative analytics end-to-end with direct access to relevant tools, databases, and sources to create powerful and visually appealing insights.We all know that we are not perfect. But we are working on it together. We are developing our coding, stakeholder management, or project management skills together by having an open feedback culture and regular code reviews. We are part of the big Zalando Data Analyst community and take advantage of frequent meetings where we can learn new skills in personal exchange with great and inspiring colleagues.WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IFYou are keen on data-driven process optimization and have experience in Intralogistics processes in E-Commerce, Retail, or Automotive.You have profound skills in using SQL, python, and git. You can create reports and dashboards from scratch. title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Buchhaltung - Ravensburg oder remote
jobdesc: Unsere Finance Abteilung unterstützt die AniCura Kliniken und Praxen in der DACH Region (Deutschland, Österreich, Schweiz) bei betriebswirtschaftlichen Fragestellungen sowie wickelt die gesamte Buchhaltung ab. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Kontaktaufnahme!Über AniCura:AniCura ist eine auf die tierärztliche Versorgung von Haustieren spezialisierte Familie namhafter Tierkliniken und Tierarztpraxen. Wir behandeln in mehr als 400 Kliniken und Praxen in Europa über 3,3 Millionen Patienten im Jahr. Es ist AniCuras Ambition, tiermedizinische Qualität auf höchstem Niveau zu bieten. title: (Junior) Security Analyst (m/f/d)
jobdesc: Job DescriptionWe are currently looking for a(Junior) Security Analystwho is eager to learn and join ourInformation Security Team.OurSecurity Teamensures that customers of our online shop have a safe shopping experience and their personal data is secure with us. In addition, the team also protects our corporate data and the hardware of our employees. Protecting customer and company information is an important part of our business and our team is passionate about bringing security to the next level. Our goal is to create a secure environment without restricting or slowing down business processes.We are looking for a(Junior)Security Analystwho is passionate to work on security-related topics and wants to build up knowledge in security monitoring, threat hunting and security event management.What you will doTriage vulnerability reports submitted through our bug bounty programInvestigate and respond to security alerts in our systems (L1 response)Participate in employee security awareness trainingImprove our monitoring and scanning tools to detect security issues and automate routine tasks. Python / Bash programming requiredKeep an eye on current threats and zero-day vulnerabilities in the cyber security space and implement preventative measures within the organizationAnalyze possible vulnerabilities, weaknesses and misconfigurations within our cloud infrastructure and web application firewallsProvide first response during security incidents, including digital forensics and post incident risk mitigationWho you areYou have some background in Computer Science, IT Administration and/or SecurityYou are interested in ethical hacking, penetration testing, reverse engineering and/or digital forensicsYou understand the basics of computer networking, firewalls, and VPNsYou are able to write scripts and programs to automate tasks in Python or BashYou are able to process large quantities of information from multiple sources, like emails, firewall and access logs, Slack alerts, etc.You are familiar with Linux and/or Windows OSYou have good communication and presentation skills, you can explain technical terms in non-technical languageFluent English skills (spoken & written)Some knowledge in cloud architecture is beneficial. Experience in AWS is a strong plusBenefitsGrow together with one of the fastest growing eCommerce companies in EuropeFlexible working times40% discount on our online shopFresh fruits + drinks everywhereLanguage courses (German & English)Free sports courses & reduced price for gym membershipSubsidized public transportation ticketFree choice of hardware and operating system (Mac, Windows, Linux) also for private usageState-of-the-art tech stack running on AWSModern office in the city center of HamburgInternational working environment and English as company languageCompany flats (subject to availability)Agile work environment (MOVE) and cross-functional teamsFree access to Germany’s greatest developer conference code.talksFree Laracasts and Egghead accountHelp in relocation and VISA processYOU ARE THE CORE OF ABOUT YOU.We take responsibility for creating an inclusive and exceptional environment where all genders, nationalities and ethnicities feel welcomed and accepted exactly as they are. We believe that a diverse workforce essentially contributes to the ABOUT YOU culture. In order to maintain talent and diversity, we emphasize the care for physical health, mental health and overall well-being. Our values and work ethics essentially contribute to our brand mission: empower acceptance and shape an inclusive, fair and circular fashion culture.We are looking forward to receiving your application – preferably via our online application portal! Thus, we can ensure a faster process and for you it is very easy to upload your application documents. :-)

title: Quantitative Analyst – Model Trading
jobdesc: Volue is a leading provider of energy trading solutions as software services and algorithmic trading strategies in Europe. We deliver cutting-edge technologies in the area of software services and energy trading services covering the entire value chain, from the optimization of power plants to market data, price forecasting and algorithmic trading.Volue Trading Advisory (VTA) receives mandates from its clients to implement and run trading strategies in the short-term power market on their accounts. We develop and implement strategies, from the trading idea along the mathematical modelling of the underlying forecast model and the fully automated execution on our clients' exchange accounts. Market areas are Central Europe and Scandinavia.As aQuantitativeAnalystin Volue Trading Advisory you will become an expert in market model based automated power trading and can develop towards aQuantitative Trading Advisor.You will get insight into market models, trading strategies and services that you will further shape.What you will be doing to make a difference:Market data: Analysis, evaluation and further development of automated data feeds.Development of market models, trading strategies and execution in our back-testing framework.Automatic trading: Further development and maintenance of our algorithmic trading strategy services.Creation of test descriptions, automated tests and documentation.What you need to succeed:Degree in mathematics, physics or comparable, solid quantitative background.Professional experience in a quantitative trading environment, ideally in short-term energy trading, but also in finance.Mastery of mathematical techniques to describe market dynamics using fundamental factors such as weather and power plant availability.Experience in using quantitative techniques, especially time series analysis, and with large market data sets.Programming experience in .NET C#, SQL, as well as in one of the languages MatLAB, Python or R.Strong analytical thinking skills, ability to work through problems independently and self-motivated or as part of a team.Goal-oriented approach, coupled with entrepreneurial vision.Strong ability to work in a team with quantitative analysts (trading advisors) and developers in setting up market data and trading processes.Strong interest in energy markets, energy trading and relevant regulatory issues.Fluency in English, German is beneficial.Reasons to join Volue team and what we offer:Working at the algorithmic trading core of an innovative, growing company, enabling the green transitionCreative work environment with great learning opportunities in algorithmic trading, data analytics and software developmentLarge degree of influence in shaping & developing the role furtherGreat colleagues in one of Europe’s most exciting green tech companiesAttractive salary with profit-sharing/competitive compensation package30 days annual leaveFlexible working hours and the opportunity to work from homeIn Volue, we cherish each employee’s competence, ideas and personality. Let your skills and talent be a part of our team – and let us leave our mark on the world together!Company CultureIn Volue, we believe that in order to be a successful company, we need to bring everyone to the table.We look at diversity as a competitive advantage. A diverse workforce enables better decision-making and creates more value. By inclusion, we refer to the sense of belonging and being part of a community at work. We want the people of Volue to feel welcome, valued and not least encouraged to bring their whole, unique selves to work.Volue is about people. From staff to client, people are at the center of all our operations, and we always strive for a flat structure where everyone feels included, appreciated and recognized for their individual efforts. Or as we call it "ONE Volue". We hire talented individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, cultural background or religious beliefs.

title: Quantitative Analyst (m/f/x) - Algo Trading Model Validation Specialist
jobdesc: CRO OverviewThe Chief Risk Office function has Group-wide responsibility for the management and control of all credit, market, operational, enterprise and liquidity risks and has the responsibility of continual development of methods for risk measurement, frameworks and creating a bank wide strong risk culture. Deutsche Bank has been named ‘Bank Risk Manager of the Year’ by the leading publication risk.net for the second consecutive year (2020 & 2021).OverviewYou will join the Model Risk Management (MoRM) team which provides independent oversight and governance for senior managers of model analytics and their implementation into the risk architecture that drive valuation, risk, and stress results. Model Validation as part of MoRM is responsible for the independent review and analysis of all pricing and algo trading models used for valuation and risk across the bank.As a Model Validation Specialist you will be responsible for validating models. You will validate the appropriateness of model usages as well as its appropriateness for the existing internal and external banking environment and, if required, carries out your own analysis to assess the models. You will be responsible for creating validation reports.What You’ll DoYou willReview, analyse and perform robust independent model validation for algo trading modelsPerform model validation testing and derive conclusions resulting in a proper assessment of the model risk involvedReview and study the mathematical models used, implementation methods, products traded in these markets, and the associated risksPresent outcomes from reviews and studies in high quality reports to key model stakeholders including: Front Office Trading; Front Office QuantsSkills You’ll NeedAcademic degree (Masters, PhD) in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematical Finance / Statistics, Maths, Physics, Engineering) with preferably a focus on applications.Relevant experience (+2 years) either as a model developer or validator.You have highly analytical skills, deep understanding of mathematical/statistical models and their implementation in finance.Experience in scientific programming and data visualization in Python or R.Experience in working with tick data databases for validation analysis is preferredYou have a hands-on-mentality, good communication skills, you are able to work independently and as a part of a larger team.What we will offer you:https://careers.db.com/explore-the-bank/working-environment/benefits-wellbeing/Please note that this may vary slightly from location to location.In case of any recruitment related questions, please get in touch with Andreas Vogel.Contact: Andreas Vogel ( +49 151 27727513)Unsere Werte bestimmen das Arbeitsumfeld, welches wir schaffen möchten – vielfältig, wertschätzend und offen für verschiedene Meinungen. Nur eine Unternehmenskultur, die eine Vielzahl von Perspektiven, sowie kulturellen und gesellschaftlichen Hintergründen vereint, fördert Innovation. Wir setzten auf vielfältige Teams, in welchen die Menschen ihr volles Potential entfalten können – denn das Zusammenführen verschiedener Talente und Ideen spielt eine entscheidende Rolle für den geschäftlichen Erfolg der Deutschen Bank.Unsere Unternehmenskultur setzt hohe ethische Standards und fördert ein gutes Miteinander. Unabhängig von kulturellem Hintergrund, Nationalität, ethnischer Zugehörigkeit, geschlechtlicher und sexueller Identität, körperlichen Fähigkeiten, Religion und Generation freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen talentierter Menschen.Sprechen Sie uns an: Wir bieten flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und weitere Zusatzleistungen, um Sie in Ihrem Berufsleben zu unterstützen.Klicken Sie hier für weitere Informationen zu Vielfalt und Teilhabe in der Deutschen Bank.

title: Technical Data Analyst (all genders welcome)
jobdesc: DESCRIPTIONTo build our new team at our office in Dresden, we are looking for aTechnical Data Analyst (all genders welcome)The high-tech devices from ROSEN are used worldwide for in-line inspections (ILI) of large oil and gas pipes. These “pigs” traverse the pipelines and record large amounts of data that can be used to detect damage (e.g. cracks, corrosion, dents) in the pipe wall.
